item.title: Second Test Questions
item.description: Our second test, on Wednesday May 18, will be in our regular classroom, but at our registrar-assigned time, 10:30 AM. It will be designed to take at least an hour. You will have until 12:30 PM to finish it. Content This test will cover the whole course, but with a strong emphasis on the second half. How to study To study for the test review and think about the answers to the Learning Questions for each of our units to date, and try to find the main ideas for each of the readings and/or class presentations.

item.title: First Test Questions
item.description: Our first test will take place during class on March 16. How to study To study for the test review and think about the answers to the Learning Questions for each of our units to date, and try to find the main arguments for each of the readings and/or class presentations. Think about integration among the topics — to how they might be understood as answer to the same, more general questions.

item.title: Interpreting Grades
item.description: This note about grading and interpreting grades just adds some detail to what the course syllabus already says about grading. 4-point scale Grades in this course are assigned and calculated using Hofstra’s 4-point scale (described here in the Hofstra Bulletin). Following the Bulletin, the alphabetical grades, including plus (+) and minus (–), have the following 4-point scale values (and vice versa): letter 4pt Student’s academic performance … A 4.0 “was of honors level.
